author: Staff Reporter
text:
Sulur Police registered cases against a few villagers and cadre of All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) for a clash during the birthday celebration of Chief Minister Jayalalithaa that was organised at Arasur Colony near Neelambur on Sunday evening.

Around 7.30 p.m. on Sunday, AIADMK cadre organised a procession to a temple to offer special prayers for their party leader who will celebrate her 68{+t}{+h}birthday on Wednesday. They reportedly blocked the road and played a song praising the Chief Minister in the temple which was objected by a group of villagers.

A clash erupted between A. Neelakandan (23) and his friends K. Sathish Kumar (27), K. Balakrishnan (26) and C. Mohankumar (30) of that village and AIADMK cadre Vijay, Sundaramoorthy, Ravi, Vijayakumar, Dharmaraj and Ganesamoorthy that night.

On a complaint from AIADMK member K. Rajan, Neelakandan and his friends were booked under section 294(B) (using abusive language), 323 (voluntarily causing hurt), 324 (voluntarily causing hurt by dangerous weapons or means) and 506(i) (criminal intimidation) of the Indian Penal Code.

Mohan Kumar, who was injured in the clash, was admitted to Coimbatore Medical College Hospital. The three others were arrested and remanded. Similarly, based on a complaint lodged by Mohan Kumar, AIADMK cadre Vijay and five others were booked under section 147 (punishment for rioting), 294(B), 323, 324 and 506(i) of the IPC.

Meanwhile, relatives of the villagers thronged the office of the Superintendent of Police on Tuesday alleging biased action by the police by not arresting the accused from AIADMK. Denying any foul play, the Sulur Police said that they were taking steps to arrest the AIADMK cadre involved in the incident.
title: Group clash: case registered
